","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jqsa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pkem","text":"iPSCs are maintained in 35mm plates or 6 well plates in mTESR+ media (https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.ewov1qd5ogr2/v1). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adqh8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d41h","text":"Lentiviral vectors were generated by transfecting HEK293T cells with lentivirus packaging plasmids (pMDLg/pRRE, VsVG and pRSV-REV) with the desired vectors as previously described (Pang et al., 2011) using lipofectamine 3000. The following plasmids were used:  pMDLg/pRRE (Addgene 12251), pRSV-Rev (Addgene #12253), pCMV-VSV-G (Addgene #8454), FUW-M2rtTA (Addgene #20342), FUW-TetO-Ngn2-P2A-puromycin (Addgene #52047), FUW-TetO-Ascl1-T2A-puromycin (Addgene #97329), FUW-TetO-Dlx2-IRES-hygromycin (Addgene #97330). Lentiviral particles were collected in mTESR+ media and stored at -80°C until further use. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37d9p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnrsm","text":"Induced neurons are generated by transducing iPSCs with the necessary genes using the lentiviral vectors to induce the expression of different transcription factors with doxycycline: rtTA + Ngn2 for excitatory neurons, rtTA + Ascl1 + Dlx2 for inhibitory neurons. Induced neurons are plated into 96 well plates (18×103 cells) or in 12 well plates (1×106 cells) with mouse glia after 5 days of induction. Primary mouse glia was obtained from postnatal day 0-2 mice cortex kept in DMEM 10% FBS 1% pen/strep, glia is used for plating after the second or third passage (P2-P3). CEPT cocktail was used during iPSC and neuronal plating to enhance cell viability (Chen et al., 2021). Induced neurons are cultured for 30-35 days before analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":316,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":351,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hthk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5070o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43ucb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c38ln","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hp48","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95j5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":286,"id":457420,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"395ci\",\"text\":\"Overview
